subject: RE: [junit] Re: How to use JUnits for PL/SQL Stored Procedure
msgSnippet: ... You shouldn t be using == on strings.  Instead: assertEquals(query, 0 ); seems more correct to me. -- Cédric http://beust.com/weblog
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of sarathy_groups

> finally I got the count of the table using a query (select
> count(*) from <table name> )after executing tat pl/sql
> procedure to see whether its 0 or not
>
> and assertEquals(query=="0",true) for junit testing,

You shouldn't be using == on strings. Instead:

assertEquals(query, "0");

seems more correct to me.

--
Cédric
http://beust.com/weblog
